caption: Overpriced. I was expecting more. The Mushroom skewer was the best of my meal. They could have at least included miso soup and chopsticks with the takeout order at these prices. The yakitori was better than what many places serve, but I’ve had better from street vendors in Japan. The wagyu fried rice is good, if a bit salty, but not what one expects for the price/portion. It may be enjoyable if one is eating in (especially for drinkers), but the takeout wasn’t worth a drive into the city. I’m glad I waited to try this after a celebration dinner instead of for the day of celebration—it just wasn’t worth what I paid. It’s not bad at all, it’s just not fantastic either.
Very expensive considering the portion. And the food is mediocre. Won’t go there again
Food was amazing! Staffs are very friendly.
Food was trash.  Service was good though.

This place is such a hidden gem! Food was incredible and COVID-19 safety precautions were definitely taken seriously. My boyfriend and I enjoyed our meal a lot though portions do seem a bit pricey for the dishes especially the meat / veggies on the skewers. The maze udon / maze soba was soooo good and I usually don’t like to eat pork!
Food is decent but very pricey for its level

I went to TenGoky Aburiya on a Friday night. It was quiet and made for an amazing dinner spot! Everyone was well spaced out and they took all the necessary precautions to make it covid safe. The service was excellent! All the food came super fast and wow the food was SO GOOD. The sashimi was so fresh and was such a good value for how much you got! We also got the T.T. Roll which was really good and has a nice kick to it! We also got the tako yaki and the maze soba. Everything was amazing. The noodles in the soba were cooked perfectly! I highly recommend this place to anyone and everyone!!!

Best authentic Izakaya in the city.  Don't come in here expecting fine dining or dramatic presentation.  TenGoku offers extremely delicious, well priced (for the neighborhood...half price of Momotaro) food and drink.  This is the neighborhood Japanese spot. Come here after a fun night, or for some Sake, Japanese beer, and great salty dishes. Drink, eat, and be happy.  Service is personal and genuine. What Wishbone is to Southern cooking, and JTap is to the local football bar, Tengoku is a unique opportunity to be transported back to a classic Izakaya in Japan.  The star here is the Kushiyaki. Negima is our favorite, but everything is delicious and flavorful. Also none of this BS wagyu from Australia. This is the Japanese Beef. Excellent flavor both in the Kushiyaki and the fried rice!  We've been back two weeks in a row...and will likely be back for weeks to come.

A wonderful place to have breakfast!  They offer a bunch of traditional breakfast dishes in addition to Mexican influenced yummy dishes.  My favorite is their bacon, avocado & tomatoes omelette.  Service is great and there is even out doors seating. They run the gigantic fire place on cold days which makes the place even cozier.  Prices are reasonable and food is always made to order.

DELICIOUS and excellent hospitality!  We really appreciates the extra precautions taken here during covid with temperature checks and hand sanitizer.  The menu had a lot of variety and we enjoyed everything we ordered.

Some of the best sushi I've had in Chicago! The TenGoku roll was amazing, their tempura batter is delicious and you can tell it's just out of the fryer. The Maze Soba was amazing as well. Prices are great, especially for the location. If you like Japanese cuisine, try it!!!

The food was absolutely delicious and the service was amazing, our waitress was so hospitable. The prices are really reasonable for West Loop. The only negative reviews on here talked about portion size, most of the small dishes are literally between $2 and $6...The bigger dishes, like the Maze Soba, is only $18 and it's a huge portion and was fantastic tasting. I highly recommend! Excited to try their sister restaurant Omakase Yume next!
So tasty, I'll be a fan of this restaurant! Will visit again for sure.
It is a $29 Ikura-Uni Don. My girl friend has a small hand and look at how small the bowl is. The uni tastes like the cheap uni that we buy from Hmart
The plate is so small. And it is so expensive considering its size and quality. It is screwing up the reputation of its sister restaurant, Omakase Yume. Won’t try it again.

This place is delicious! The staff is great but let's talk about the food! Get the Agedashi Avocado, it will change your life! The kushiyaki is a must! Try all of them! Enjoyable, delightful and you will meet the owners, what is better than that?!
Great Japanese spot! Menu is full of different options, udon, sushi, donburi, etc. Also great selection of sake. Can't wait to go back!
